_source.text: [1] C. L. Moore's Northwest Smith stories also benefit, by the way, rather as Poe's works do: French seems to convey decayed ambience better than English does, outside the works of Jack Vance - for him one imagines the Paris editions likely crumble to dust of their own volition.

_source.text: 4:06 p.m. Eastern - On the "Live from the Presidents Cup" pre-game show, Brandel Chamblee agrees with Jack Nicklaus' comments aired the previous day "that the Presidents Cup is better than the Ryder Cup." Why? "Two of the nine (matches) have gone to Royal Melbourne, and that venue allows for separation."

_source.text: After 12 days in Brazil and three in KC, nothing was better than a session on the #dreamdriveway with @alejandirt (bs smith), @porpe, @jiwajata, @mannyrodriguez1, @shaqueefaog, Dustin, Jack, Treshan, and whomever else I'm forgetting.
